      • getBodyParts

        public static List<javax.mail.Part> getBodyParts(javax.mail.Part actualEmail)
                                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Retrieve the body parts of the message (recursively):
        • The part of the message when it contains only one part
        • The parts with text/* mimetype
        Parameters:
        actualEmail - the message
        Returns:
        the body of the message
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getBodyPart

        public static javax.mail.Part getBodyPart(javax.mail.Part actualEmail)
                                   throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Retrieve the main part of the message (recursively):
        • The part of the message when it contains only one part
        • The part with text/* mimetype if only one part with one of that mimetype
        • The last part with text or HTML mimetype if there are several text/* parts
        Parameters:
        actualEmail - the message
        Returns:
        the body of the message
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getAlternativePart

        public static javax.mail.Part getAlternativePart(javax.mail.Part actualEmail)
                                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Retrieve the alternative part of the message (recursively). The alternative is useful when sending HTML email that may be unreadable on some email clients. For example, a smartphone will display the 2 or 3 first lines as a summary. Many smartphones will take the HTML message as-is and will display HTML tags instead of content of email. Alternative is used to provide a textual visualization of the message that will be readable by any system.

        The alternative of the message is either:

        • null if there is only one part
        • null if there is only one text or HTML part
        • the first part if there are more than one text or HTML part
        Parameters:
        actualEmail - the message
        Returns:
        the alternative part of the message if exists, null otherwise
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getTextualParts

        public static List<javax.mail.Part> getTextualParts(javax.mail.Part actualEmail)
                                             throws javax.mail.MessagingException

      • getContent

        public static byte[] getContent(javax.mail.Part part)
                         throws IOException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get the content as byte array of a particular part.

        If the part is null or the content stream is null, then null is returned.

        Parameters:
        part - the part
        Returns:
        the content as byte array or null
        Throws:
        IOException - when part can't be read
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getContent

        public static String getContent(javax.mail.Part part,
                                Charset charset)
                         throws IOException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get the content as String of a particular part.

        NOTE: This method handles a special case due to how Java Mail sends textual content (adds CRLF) If the content is a textual content ("text/*" mimetype) and the part has no parent and it ends with CRLF, remove the last CRLF. If your original text had the CRLF, this method can't know that it was already part of the original text because Java Mail only adds CRLF if there not already has CRLF at the end of the text.

        If the part is null or the content stream is null, then null is returned.

        Parameters:
        part - the part
        charset - the charset used to decode the part content
        Returns:
        the part content
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when the part can't be accessed
        IOException - when the part content can't be read

      • getAttachment

        public static javax.mail.BodyPart getAttachment(javax.mail.Multipart multipart,
                                                String filename)
                                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get a particular attachment (found using exact filename field).

        the found attachment or null
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getAttachment

        public static javax.mail.BodyPart getAttachment(javax.mail.Multipart multipart,
                                                Predicate<javax.mail.Part> filter)
                                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get a particular attachment (found using provided predicate). If several attachments match the predicate, only the first one is retrieved.
        Parameters:
        multipart - the email that contains several parts
        filter - the predicate used to find the attachment
        Returns:
        the found attachment or null
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getAttachments

        public static List<javax.mail.BodyPart> getAttachments(javax.mail.Part message)
                                                throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get the whole list of attachments (recursively).
        Parameters:
        message - the email that contains several parts
        Returns:
        the found attachments or empty list
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • getAttachments

        public static <T extends javax.mail.Part> List<T> getAttachments(javax.mail.Part message,
                                                                 Predicate<javax.mail.Part> filter)
                                                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Get the whole list of attachments.

        WARNING: As there is no way to ensure that a part is an attachment, every part is testing against the filter (event multipart containers). So the filter that you provide is combined with DefaultAttachmentPredicate. This way, only the list of parts that may be potential attachments (downloadable or embeddable) are provided to your filter.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of part
        Parameters:
        message - the email that contains several parts
        filter - filter the parts to keep only some attachments. If filter returns true then the part is added to the list.
        Returns:
        the found attachments or empty list
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when message can't be read

      • isMultipart

        public static boolean isMultipart(javax.mail.Part part)
        Indicates if a part is a multipart (its Content-Type starts with "multipart/").
        Parameters:
        part - the part to check
        Returns:
        true if a multipart

      • isTextualContent

        public static boolean isTextualContent(javax.mail.Part part)
        Indicates if the part contains text (either plain text or html). It is checked using Content-Type (either "text/*", "application/html" or "application/xhtml").
        Parameters:
        part - the part to check
        Returns:
        true if it is text
